intro: Potamogeton filiformis subvar. helveticus, commonly known as the slender pondweed, is a submerged aquatic plant native to freshwater habitats in Europe. It has long, narrow, ribbon-like leaves that are typically 1–2 mm wide and can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or brown, arranged in clusters at the base of the stems. It thrives in shallow, slow-moving waters with soft, muddy or sandy substrates. This subvariety is often found in lakes, ponds, and slow streams, contributing to water clarity by stabilizing sediments.
